Title: Hungary, Slovakia block new sanctions package on Russia over gas ban
Description: Hungary and Slovakia have vetoed the adoption of the EU’s 18th sanctions package on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, as the countries said a complete ban on Russian energy purchases would undermine their energy security.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere takes FID on Corpus Christi Midscale Trains 8 & 9 expansion
Description: Cheniere Energy has taken a final investment decision (FID) on the Corpus Christi Midscale Trains 8 & 9 and debottlenecking project and has issued full notice to proceed to Bechtel for construction.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt races to ready Energos Power FSRU for Ain Sukhna deployment
Description: Egypt is accelerating preparations for the deployment of the 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit, fast-tracking modification works to ensure the vessel is installed at Ain Sukhna as soon as possible, amid mounting pressure to bolster gas supplies ahead of peak summer demand.
Author: CK

Title: Rebound in gas flows to Sabine Pass signals end of scheduled compressor maintenance
Description: Pipeline gas flows to the Cheniere-operated 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG terminal in Louisiana rebounded sharply on June 23, indicating the likely completion of planned maintenance at the Gillis Compressor Station.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship traffic through Strait of Hormuz seen picking up after Israel-Iran ceasefire
Description: The number of LNG vessels transiting the Strait of Hormuz looks set to rise sharply today compared to recent days, potentially marking the start of a broader increase in flows through the key shipping chokepoint following the declaration of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s OLT FSRU Toscana completes testing of small-scale LNG service
Description: OLT Offshore LNG Toscana has completed the commissioning of its new small-scale LNG service at the FSRU Toscana terminal off the coast of Livorno, making it the first facility in Italy to offer LNG loading and unloading for small-scale carriers and marine bunkering operations.
Author: CK

Title: Jones Act-compliant American Energy LNG carrier delivers fourth cargo to Puerto Rico
Description: The 130,405 m3 American Energy LNG carrier, owned by US shipping and logistics firm Crowley, made its fourth US-sourced LNG delivery to the Penuelas LNG terminal in Puerto Rico on June 18, marking the continued delivery by the Jones Act-compliant ship in supporting Puerto Rico’s energy needs.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt expedites second FSRU deployment plan, installation expected by month-end
Description: Egypt is fast-tracking the installation of its second LNG import terminal, with the 160,000m3 Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit now expected to be deployed at the Sumed port in Ain Sukhna by June 30 — ahead of schedule — as the country races to meet soaring summer demand and offset a recent disruption in Israeli gas flows following the start of the Israel-Iran conflict, sources close to the project said.
Author: CK
